nodes.title: Space removed after annotation - Want to keep it
nodes.bodyText:
When using Play DI Guice, I would like to keep the space after the @Inject annotation
Version: scalafmt 0.5.0-RC2
Integration: cli
Configuration: style=defaultWithAlign
class Foo @Inject() (conf: Configuration)
Scalafmt:
class Foo @Inject()(conf: Configuration)
I would like the input to look like this:
class Foo @Inject() (conf: Configuration)
I think I can help with a PR if you could point me in the right direction/where to start.
And thank you for this amazing project ðŸ» , I've been using it for a few weeks now, it has been really useful since I moved from IntelliJ to Emacs

nodes.title: Space on both sides of operator method definition
nodes.bodyText:
Feature request: an option to surround symbolic method names with exactly one space on both sides.

Version: 0.6.8
Integration: sbt
Configuration: default

Problem
Scalafmt formats code like this:
trait Test[A] {
  def <=>[B](that: Test[B]): Int
}
Expectation
I would like the formatted output to look like this:
trait Test[A] {
  def <=> [B](that: Test[B]): Int
}
Note the space immediately after the <=> method name. It mirrors how it would typically appear at callsites: x <=> y. (Obviously the <=> operator is just an example.)

nodes.title: Refactor GitOps
nodes.bodyText:
Fetching of files is a bit ad-hock at the moment (using boolean variables to call either some in-line file-fetching function or GitOpsImpl). We should have a single FileFetcher trait that has two implementations: one that uses git and the other that uses plain, recursive file searching.
Additionally, GitOpsImpl currently uses sys.process, which is being removed. It should be replaced.
